app_metadata.description: Monero is a private, decentralized cryptocurrency that keeps your finances confidential and secure.
app_metadata.name: monerod
app_metadata.title: Monero Node

attrs.label: Prune the blockchain
attrs.description:
A pruned Monero blockchain will take up about 1/3rd the storage space of an unpruned node.
If you have the extra space and wish to contribute more resources to the Monero network,
consider disabling the prune option. A pruned node provides nearly all of the advantages of an unpruned node,
so if you are unsure, leave this option enabled.

attrs.label: Advertise as publicly-available
attrs.description:
If you wish to make it easier for other people to connect their wallet with your node, enable this option. This sets --public-node and --confirm-external-bind if enabled, and --hide-my-port if disabled.
If you are unsure, leave this option enabled.

attrs.label: Enable community DNS Blocklist
attrs.description: Unless you have a good reason to disable this option, leave this option enabled.

attrs.label: Enable logging
attrs.description: Unless you encounter an issue and wish to review the logs, leave this option disabled.

attrs.label: Enable Tor connections
attrs.description: Requires a connection to a Tor SOCKS proxy, such as the Arti TrueNAS App.

attrs.label: Tor IP
attrs.description: Enter the local IP of this machine if you are running the Arti TrueNAS App.

attrs.label: Inbound onion address
attrs.description: Port needs to be configured under "Network".

attrs.label: Route all traffic through
attrs.description:
If in the default "Clearnet (no proxy)" mode,
normal peer to peer connections with this node will be made over the clearnet,
but transaction broadcasts will be made over Tor.
If "Tor" is selected, then ALL connections will be made over Tor.
This will significantly reduce your node's performance.
For nearly all use-cases, leave this set to "Clearnet (no proxy)".

attrs.label: Enable I2P connections
attrs.description: Requires a connection to an I2P SOCKS proxy, such as the I2P TrueNAS App.

attrs.label: I2P IP
attrs.description: Enter the local IP of this machine if you are running the I2P TrueNAS App.

attrs.label: Inbound I2P base32 address
attrs.description: Port needs to be configured under "Network".

attrs.label: Additional flags
attrs.description:
Additional monerod commands can be provided here.
If you are unsure, leave this blank.
Reference: https://docs.getmonero.org/interacting/monerod-reference/#options

attrs.label: P2P Port
attrs.description: The port used for your node to communicate blockchain data with other nodes. This should be published for external access in most scenarios.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: RPC Port
attrs.description: This is the unrestricted RPC endpoint which will only be made available on the local network. Unless you specifically need this, leave it disabled.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Restricted RPC Port
attrs.description:
This is the restricted RPC endpoint which is safe to expose publicly. This allows Monero wallet users to connect to your node. Use in conjunction with "Advertise as publicly-available". If you do not want Monero wallet users to connect to your node, set the bind mode to "None" (for no RPC access) or "Expose port for inter-container communication" (for RPC access only to other TrueNAS apps).</br>
Note that unless you configure SSL for your node separately, for example with Cloudflare or Nginx, then all wallet RPC traffic will be unencrypted which has privacy risks.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:

- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

attrs.label: Blockchain storage location
attrs.description:
Use SSDs for reasonable performance.
You will have a very bad time trying to sync a Monero node on HDDs. </br>
We recommend at least 200GB of free space if pruning is enabled and at least 500GB if pruning is disabled.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Type

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>

SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.
